hook_plan.narration: Stop! Jensen Huang just revealed a critical AI memory shift impacting every semiconductor investor.
hook_plan.image_description: A determined CEO's cybernetic eye reflecting a flickering red stock market crash graph, digital corruption effect, red warning lights, cinematic lighting.

thumbnail_plan.image_description: Hyper-realistic 3D render of a single, glowing HBM chip stack placed centrally on a dark, reflective surface, surrounded by subtle blue and purple neon light, 8k resolution.
thumbnail_plan.reasoning: Presents a critical industry question about a key component (HBM) in a visually striking, high-contrast manner, appealing to both engineers and investors by highlighting a potential supply bottleneck.

segments.text: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang confirmed escalating AI memory needs during his Taiwan visit, signaling sustained GPU demand growth.
segments.image_prompt: A serious-faced CEO with cybernetic-enhanced smart glasses, reviewing holographic wafer schematics, dramatic side lighting, focused expression.

segments.text: This surge specifically targets High Bandwidth Memory (HBM), essential for next-gen AI accelerators like Nvidia's Blackwell series.
segments.image_prompt: Extreme close-up of interconnected High Bandwidth Memory (HBM) stacks on an advanced GPU package, glowing data lines, 8k resolution.

segments.text: Huang also endorsed TSMC's global expansion, critical for meeting high-volume, advanced packaging requirements for AI chips.
segments.image_prompt: Panoramic view inside a futuristic semiconductor fabrication plant (fab), robotic arms in motion, with a translucent global map overlay showing expansion nodes, cinematic lighting.

segments.text: TSMC's projected CAPEX will heavily factor into 2024-2025 chip production, influencing overall supply chain stability and costs.
segments.image_prompt: Abstract data visualization showing rising capital expenditure (CAPEX) graphs projected onto a digital financial interface, reflecting data in a glowing iris, serious thought expression.

segments.text: Market analysts are reassessing AI stock valuations, anticipating increased investment in HBM production and foundry capacity.
segments.image_prompt: Dynamic stock market charts overlaid with semiconductor chip icons, digital glitches indicating market volatility, through a data analyst's smart glasses, intense focus expression.

segments.text: This signals rising HBM CAPEX, impacting 2025 GPU valuation forecasts.
segments.image_prompt: Close-up of a next-generation GPU with integrated HBM, numerical '2025' data streams flowing across its surface, deep blue and purple neon lighting, 8k resolution.
